member.name: Windows.AssocCreate
member.summary: Returns a pointer to an object.
member.param: The CLSID of the object that exposes the interface. This parameter must be set to CLSID_QueryAssociations, which is defined in Shlguid.h.
Reference to the IID IID_IQueryAssociations, which is defined in Shlguid.h.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.AssocGetPerceivedType
member.summary: Retrieves a file's perceived type based on its extension.
member.param: A pointer to a buffer that contains the file's extension. This should include the leading period, for example ".txt".
A pointer to a value that indicates the perceived type.

param.name: pflag
param.para: A pointer to a value that indicates the source of the perceived type information. One or more of the following values.
No perceived type was found ().
The perceived type was determined through an association in the registry.
The perceived type is inherently known to Windows.
The perceived type was determined through a codec provided with Windows.
The perceived type is supported by the GDI+ library.
The perceived type is supported by the Windows Media SDK.
The perceived type is supported by Windows compressed folders.

member.param: If the function returns a success code, this contains the address of a pointer to a buffer that receives the perceived type string, for instance "text" or "video". This value can be NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.AssocIsDangerous
member.summary: Determines whether a file type is considered a potential security risk.
member.param: A pointer to a string that contains the type of file in question. This may be either an extension such as ".exe" or a progid such as "exefile".
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the file type is considered dangerous; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: Windows.AssocQueryKey
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves a key related to a file or protocol association from the registry.
member.param: The flags that can be used to control the search. It can be any combination of ASSOCF values, except that only one ASSOCF_INIT value can be included.
The value that specifies the type of key that is to be returned.

param.name: pszAssoc
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that is used to determine the root key. Four types of strings can be used.
A file name extension, such as .txt.
A CLSID GUID in the standard "{GUID}" format.
An application's ProgID, such as Word.Document.8.
The name of an application's .exe file. The flag must be set in flags.

member.param: A pointer to an optional null-terminated string with additional information about the location of the string. It is normally set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
A pointer to the key's HKEY value.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM error value otherwise.

member.name: Windows.AssocQueryString
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves a file or protocol association-related string from the registry.
member.param: The flags that can be used to control the search. It can be any combination of ASSOCF values, except that only one ASSOCF_INIT value can be included.
The value that specifies the type of string that is to be returned.

param.name: pszAssoc
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that is used to determine the root key. The following four types of strings can be used.
A file name extension, such as .txt.
A CLSID GUID in the standard "{GUID}" format.
An application's ProgID, such as Word.Document.8.
The name of an application's .exe file. The flag must be set in flags.

member.param: An optional null-terminated string with additional information about the location of the string. It is typically set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
Pointer to a null-terminated string that, when this function returns successfully, receives the requested string. Set this parameter to NULL to retrieve the required buffer size.

param.name: pcchOut
param.para: A pointer to a value that, when calling the function, is set to the number of characters in the pszOut buffer. When the function returns successfully, the value is set to the number of characters actually placed in the buffer.
If the flag is set in flags and the buffer specified in pszOut is too small, the function returns E_POINTER and the value is set to the required size of the buffer.
If pszOut is NULL, the function returns S_FALSE and pcchOut points to the required size, in characters, of the buffer.

returns.para: Returns a standard COM error value, including the following:

listheader.description: The pszOut buffer is too small to hold the entire string.
pszOut is NULL. pcchOut contains the required buffer size.

member.name: Windows.AssocQueryStringByKey
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves a file association-related string from the registry starting from a specified key.
member.param: The flags that can be used to control the search. It can be any combination of ASSOCF values, except that only one ASSOCF_INIT value can be included.
The value that specifies the type of string that is to be returned.
The HKEY value of the key that will be used as a root key. The search looks only below this key.

A pointer to an optional null-terminated string with additional information about the location of the string. It is normally set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
A pointer to a null-terminated string used to return the requested string. Set this parameter to NULL to retrieve the required buffer size.

param.name: pcchOut
param.para: A pointer to a value that, on entry, specifies the number of characters in the pszOut buffer. When the function returns, it points to the number of characters placed in the buffer.
If the flag is set in flags and the buffer specified in pszOut is too small, the function returns E_POINTER and the value is set to the required size of the buffer.
If pszOut is NULL, the function returns S_FALSE and pcchOut points to the required size of the buffer.

returns.para: Returns a standard COM error value, including the following:

listheader.description: The pszOut buffer is too small to hold the entire string.
pszOut is NULL. pcchOut contains the required buffer size.

member.name: Windows.ChrCmpI
member.summary: Performs a comparison between two characters. The comparison is not case-sensitive.
member.param: The first character to be compared.
The second character to be compared.
member.returns: Returns zero if the two characters are the same, or nonzero otherwise.

member.summary: Performs a comparison between two characters. The comparison is not case-sensitive.
member.param: The first character to be compared.
The second character to be compared.
member.returns: Returns zero if the two characters are the same, or nonzero otherwise.

member.name: Windows.ColorAdjustLuma
member.summary: Changes the luminance of a RGB value. Hue and saturation are not affected.
member.param: The initial RGB value.
The luminance in units of 0.1 percent of the total range. For example, a value of n = 50 corresponds to 5 percent of the maximum luminance.
If fScale is set to TRUE, n specifies how much to increment or decrement the current luminance. If fScale is set to FALSE, n specifies the absolute luminance.
member.returns: Returns the modified RGB value.

member.name: Windows.ColorHLSToRGB
member.summary: Converts colors from hue-luminance-saturation (HLS) to RGB format.
member.param: The original HLS hue value. Can range from 0 to 240.
The original HLS luminance value. Can range from 0 to 240.
The original HLS saturation value. Can range from 0 to 240.
member.returns: Returns the RGB value.

member.name: Windows.ColorRGBToHLS
member.summary: Converts colors from RGB to hue-luminance-saturation (HLS) format.
member.param: The original RGB color.
A pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the HLS hue value. Can range from 0 to 240.
A pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the HLS luminance value. Can range from 0 to 240.
A pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the HLS saturation value. Can range from 0 to 240.

member.name: Windows.DllInstall
member.summary: Handles installation and setup for a DLL.
member.param: TRUE if the DLL is being installed; FALSE if it is being uninstalled.
A string passed in by regsvr32 that indicates which setup procedure to use. This value can be NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetAcceptLanguages
member.summary: Retrieves a string used with websites when specifying language preferences.
member.param: A pointer to a string that, when this function returns successfully, receives the language preferences information. We recommend that this buffer be of size 2048 characters to ensure sufficient space to return the full string. You can also call this function with this parameter set to NULL to retrieve the size of the string that will be returned.

param.name: pcchLanguages
param.para: A pointer to the size, in characters, of the string at pszLanguages.
On entry, this value is the size of pszLanguages, including the terminating null character.
On exit, it is the actual size of pszLanguages, not including the terminating null character.

member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetProcessReference
member.summary: Retrieves the process-specific object supplied by , incrementing the reference count to keep the process alive.

param.name: punk
param.para: The address of a pointer that, when this function returns successfully, points to the object supplied to the process by . Your application is responsible for freeing this resource when it is no longer needed.

A pointer to a free-threaded . Components can use this interface (through ) to prevent the host process from terminating. This value can be NULL, in which case the process reference is no longer made available to components.

member.name: Windows.IsOS
member.summary: Checks for specified operating systems and operating system features.

param.name: dwOS
param.para: A value that specifies which operating system or operating system feature to check for. One of the following values (you cannot combine values).

listheader.description:
The program is running on one of the following versions of Windows:
Windows 95
Windows 98
Windows MeEquivalent to . Note that none of those systems are supported at this time. OS_WINDOWS returns FALSE on all supported systems.
The program is running on Windows 2000 or one of its successors.

The program is running on Windows 2000 Terminal Server in either Remote Administration mode or Application Server mode, or Windows Server 2003 (or one of its successors) in Terminal Server mode or Remote Desktop for Administration mode. Consider using a more specific value such as OS_TERMINALSERVER, OS_TERMINALREMOTEADMIN, or OS_PERSONALTERMINALSERVER.
The program is running on Windows Embedded, any version. Equivalent to .
The program is running as a Terminal Server client. Equivalent to (SM_REMOTESESSION).

The program is running on Windows 2000 Terminal Server in the Remote Administration mode or Windows Server 2003 (or one of its successors) in the Remote Desktop for Administration mode (these are the default installation modes). This is equivalent to && .
The program is running on Windows NT Workstation or Windows 2000 (or one of its successors) Professional. Equivalent to && .
The program is running on Windows Datacenter Server or Windows Server Datacenter Edition, any version. Equivalent to ( || ) && .
The program is running on Windows Advanced Server or Windows Server Enterprise Edition, any version. Equivalent to ( || ) && && !.
The program is running on Windows Server (Standard) or Windows Server Standard Edition, any version. This value will not return true for , , , or .
The program is running on Windows 2000 Terminal Server in Application Server mode, or on Windows Server 2003 (or one of its successors) in Terminal Server mode. This is equivalent to && .
The program is running on Windows XP (or one of its successors), Home Edition or Professional. This is equivalent to && !.
The computer is joined to a domain.
The program is running on any Windows Server product. Equivalent to || .
The program is a 32-bit program running on 64-bit Windows.
The program is running on Microsoft Small Business Server with restrictive client license in force. Equivalent to .
The program is running on Windows XP Tablet PC Edition, or one of its successors.

The user should be presented with administrator UI. It is possible to have server administrative UI on a non-server machine. This value informs the application that an administrator's profile has roamed to a non-server, and UI should be appropriate to an administrator. Otherwise, the user is shown a mix of administrator and nonadministrator settings.
The program is running on Windows XP Media Center Edition, or one of its successors. Equivalent to (SM_MEDIACENTER).
The program is running on Windows Appliance Server.

member.returns: Returns a nonzero value if the specified operating system or operating system feature is detected, otherwise FALSE.

member.name: Windows.IStream_Copy
member.summary: Copies a stream to another stream.
member.param: A pointer to the source stream.
A pointer to the destination stream.
The number of bytes to copy from the source stream.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.IStream_Read
member.summary: Reads bytes from a specified stream and returns a value that indicates whether all bytes were successfully read.
member.param: A pointer to the interface of the stream from which to read.
A pointer to a buffer to receive the stream data from pstm. This buffer must be at least cb bytes in size.
The number of bytes of data that the function should attempt to read from the input stream.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function successfully reads the specified number of bytes from the stream, or a COM failure code otherwise. In particular, if the read attempt was successful but fewer than cb bytes were read, the function returns E_FAIL.

member.name: Windows.IStream_ReadPidl
member.summary: Reads a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) from an object into a PIDLIST_RELATIVE object.
member.param: A pointer to the from which the PIDL is read.
A pointer to the resulting PIDL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.IStream_ReadStr
member.summary: Reads from a stream and writes into a string.
member.param: A pointer to the stream from which to read.
A pointer to the null-terminated, Unicode string into which the stream is written.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.IStream_Reset
member.summary: Moves the seek position in a specified stream to the beginning of the stream.
member.param: A pointer to the interface of the stream whose position is to be reset.
member.returns: Returns S_OK on success or a COM failure code otherwise. See for further discussion of possible error codes.

member.name: Windows.IStream_Size
member.summary: Retrieves the size, in bytes, of a specified stream.
member.param: A pointer to the interface of the stream whose size is to be determined.
A pointer to a structure to receive the size of the stream.
member.returns: Returns S_OK on success or a COM failure code otherwise. See for further discussion of possible error codes.

member.name: Windows.IStream_Write
member.summary: Writes data of unknown format from a buffer to a specified stream.
member.param: An pointer that specifies the target stream.
Pointer to a buffer that holds the data to send to the target stream. This buffer must be at least cb bytes in size.
The number of bytes of data to write to the target stream.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function successfully wrote the specified number of bytes to the stream, or an error value otherwise. In particular, if less than cb bytes was written to the target stream, even if some data was successfully written, the function returns E_FAIL.

member.name: Windows.IStream_WritePidl
member.summary: Writes a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) from a PCUIDLIST_RELATIVE object into an object.
member.param: A pointer to the object in which to write.
The source PIDL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.IStream_WriteStr
member.summary: Reads from a string and writes into a stream.
member.param: A pointer to the stream in which to write.
A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode string from which to read.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_AtomicRelease
member.summary: Releases a Component Object Model (COM) pointer and sets it to NULL.
member.param: The address of a pointer to a COM interface.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_GetSite
member.summary: Calls the specified object's method.
member.param: A pointer to the COM object whose method is to be called.
The IID of the interface pointer that should be returned in ppvSite.

The address of the pointer to receive the requested interface pointer. If the function call is successful, ppvSite will contain the requested interface pointer. If no site is available or the requested interface is not supported, ppvSite is set to NULL and the function returns a COM error code.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the site was successfully retrieved or a COM error code otherwise.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_GetWindow
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve a window handle from a Component Object Model (COM) object by querying for various interfaces that have a GetWindow method.
member.param: A pointer to the COM object from which this function will attempt to obtain a window handle.
A pointer to a HWND that, when this function returns successfully, receives the window handle. If a window handle was not obtained, this parameter is set to NULL.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if a window handle was successfully returned, or a COM error code otherwise. If no suitable interface was found, the function returns E_NOINTERFACE. Otherwise, the function returns the HRESULT returned by the corresponding interface's GetWindow method.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_QueryService
member.summary: Retrieves an interface for a service from a specified object.
member.param: A pointer to the instance of the COM object that supports the service.
The service's unique identifier (SID).
The IID of the desired service interface.

When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested riid. If successful, the calling application is responsible for calling using this value when the service is no longer needed. In the case of failure, this value is NULL.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. Returns E_FAIL if the object does not support IServiceProvider. Otherwise, the function returns the HRESULT returned by the object's QueryService method.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_Set
member.summary: Changes the value of a Component Object Model (COM) interface pointer and releases the previous interface.
member.param: The address of a COM interface pointer to receive the pointer assigned to punk. If the previous value of the pointer is non-NULL, the function releases that interface by calling its IUnkown.Release method.
The interface pointer to be copied to ppunk. If the value is non-NULL, the function increments the interface's reference count.

member.name: Windows.IUnknown_SetSite
member.summary: Sets the specified object's site by calling its method.
member.param: A pointer to the IUnknown interface of the object whose site is to be changed.
A pointer to the IUnknown interface of the new site.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the site was successfully set, or a COM error code otherwise.

member.param: The major version number.
The minor version number.
The build number.
The hotfix number that identifies the service pack.

member.returns: Returns S_OK on success, or a COM error code otherwise. The function returns URL_E_INVALID_SYNTAX (defined in Intshcut.h) if the string could not be parsed as a URL.

member.name: Windows.PathAddBackslash

summary.para: Adds a backslash to the end of a string to create the correct syntax for a path. If the source path already has a trailing backslash, no backslash will be added.
summary.div: Note Misuse of this function can lead to a buffer overrun. We recommend the use of the safer or function in its place.

member.param: A pointer to a buffer with a string that represents a path. The size of this buffer must be set to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
member.returns: A pointer that, when this function returns successfully, points to the new string's terminating null character. If the backslash could not be appended due to inadequate buffer size, this value is NULL.

member.name: Windows.PathBuildRoot
member.summary: Creates a root path from a given drive number.
member.param: A pointer to the string that receives the constructed root path. This buffer must be at least four characters in size.
A variable of type int that indicates the desired drive number. It should be between 0 and 25.
member.returns: Returns the address of the constructed root path. If the call fails for any reason (for example, an invalid drive number), szRoot is returned unchanged.

member.name: Windows.PathCanonicalize

summary.para: Simplifies a path by removing navigation elements such as "." and ".." to produce a direct, well-formed path.
summary.div: Note Misuse of this function can lead to a buffer overrun. We recommend the use of the safer or function in its place.

member.param: A pointer to a string that receives the canonicalized path. You must set the size of this buffer to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be canonicalized.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if a result has been computed and the content of the lpszDst output buffer is valid. Returns FALSE otherwise, and the contents of the buffer pointed to by lpszDst are invalid. To get extended error information, call .

member.name: Windows.PathCombine

summary.para: Concatenates two strings that represent properly formed paths into one path; also concatenates any relative path elements.
summary.div: Note Misuse of this function can lead to a buffer overrun. We recommend the use of the safer or function in its place.

member.param: A pointer to a buffer that, when this function returns successfully, receives the combined path string. You must set the size of this buffer to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the first path. This value can be NULL.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the second path. This value can be NULL.
member.returns: A pointer to a buffer that, when this function returns successfully, receives the concatenated path string. This is the same string pointed to by pszPathOut. If this function does not return successfully, this value is NULL.

member.name: Windows.PathCommonPrefix
member.summary: Compares two paths to determine if they share a common prefix. A prefix is one of these types: "C:\", ".", "..", "..\".
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the first path name.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the second path name.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the common prefix. This buffer must be at least MAX_PATH characters in size. If there is no common prefix, it is set to NULL.
member.returns: Returns the count of common prefix characters in the path. If the output buffer pointer is not NULL, then these characters are copied to the output buffer.

member.name: Windows.PathCompactPath
member.summary: Truncates a file path to fit within a given pixel width by replacing path components with ellipses.
member.param: A handle to the device context used for font metrics. This value can be NULL.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be modified. On return, this buffer will contain the modified string.
The width, in pixels, in which the string must fit.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the path was successfully compacted to the specified width. Returns FALSE on failure, or if the base portion of the path would not fit the specified width.

member.name: Windows.PathCompactPathA

member.name: Windows.PathCompactPathEx
member.summary: Truncates a path to fit within a certain number of characters by replacing path components with ellipses.
member.param: The address of the string that has been altered.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be altered.

The maximum number of characters to be contained in the new string, including the terminating null character. For example, if cchMax = 8, the resulting string can contain a maximum of 7 characters plus the terminating null character.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be modified. On return, this buffer will contain the modified string.
The width, in pixels, in which the string must fit.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the path was successfully compacted to the specified width. Returns FALSE on failure, or if the base portion of the path would not fit the specified width.

member.name: Windows.PathCreateFromUrl
member.summary: Converts a file URL to a Microsoft MS-DOS path.
member.param: A null-terminated string of maximum length INTERNET_MAX_URL_LENGTH that contains the URL.

A pointer to a buffer that, when this function returns successfully, receives the MS-DOS path. You must set the size of this buffer to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
The number of characters in the pszPath buffer.
Reserved. Set this parameter to NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.PathFileExists

member.name: Windows.PathFindNextComponent
member.summary: Parses a path and returns the portion of that path that follows the first backslash.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to parse. This string must not be longer than MAX_PATH characters, plus the terminating null character. Path components are delimited by backslashes. For instance, the path "c:\path1\path2\file.txt" has four components: c:, path1, path2, and file.txt.

returns.para: Returns a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the truncated path.
If pszPath points to the last component in the path, this function returns a pointer to the terminating null character.
If pszPath points to the terminating null character or if the call fails, this function returns NULL.

member.name: Windows.PathFindOnPath

An optional, null-terminated array of directories to be searched first. This value can be NULL.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathFindSuffixArray
member.summary: Determines whether a given file name has one of a list of suffixes.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the file name to be tested. A full path can be used.
An array of iArraySize string pointers. Each string pointed to is null-terminated and contains one suffix. The strings can be of variable lengths.
The number of elements in the array pointed to by apszSuffix.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to a string with the matching suffix if successful, or NULL if pszPath does not end with one of the specified suffixes.

member.name: Windows.PathGetArgs
member.summary: Finds the command line arguments within a given path.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be searched.

returns.para: Returns a pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the arguments portion of the path if successful.
If there are no arguments in the path, the function returns a pointer to the end of the input string.
If the function is given a NULL argument it returns NULL.

member.name: Windows.PathGetCharType
member.summary: Determines the type of character in relation to a path.
member.param: The character for which to determine the type.

returns.para: Returns one or more of the following values that define the type of character.

listheader.description: The character is not valid in a path.
The character is valid in a long file name.
The character is a path separator.
The character is valid in a short (8.3) file name.
The character is a wildcard character.

member.name: Windows.PathGetDriveNumber
member.summary: Searches a path for a drive letter within the range of 'A' to 'Z' and returns the corresponding drive number.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be searched.
member.returns: Returns 0 through 25 (corresponding to 'A' through 'Z') if the path has a drive letter, or -1 otherwise.

member.returns: Returns nonzero if the file's registered content type matches pszContentType, or zero otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathIsFileSpec
member.summary: Searches a path for any path-delimiting characters (for example, ':' or '' ). If there are no path-delimiting characters present, the path is considered to be a File Spec path.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be searched.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if there are no path-delimiting characters within the path, or FALSE if there are path-delimiting characters.

member.name: Windows.PathIsSystemFolder
member.summary: Determines if an existing folder contains the attributes that make it a system folder. Alternately, this function indicates if certain attributes qualify a folder to be a system folder.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the name of an existing folder. The attributes for this folder will be retrieved and compared with those that define a system folder. If this folder contains the attributes to make it a system folder, the function returns nonzero. If this value is NULL, this function determines if the attributes passed in dwAttrb qualify it to be a system folder.

The file attributes to be compared. Used only if pszPath is NULL. In that case, the attributes passed in this value are compared with those that qualify a folder as a system folder. If the attributes are sufficient to make this a system folder, this function returns nonzero. These attributes are the attributes that are returned from .
member.returns: Returns nonzero if the pszPath or dwAttrb represent a system folder, or zero otherwise.

member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to validate.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string is a valid UNC path; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: Windows.PathIsUNCW

member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string is a valid UNC path; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: Windows.PathIsUNCServer
member.summary: Determines if a string is a valid Universal Naming Convention (UNC) for a server path only.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to validate.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string is a valid UNC path for a server only (no share name), or FALSE otherwise.

member.returns: Returns TRUE if the path has been converted, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathMakeSystemFolder

member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the name of an existing folder that will be made into a system folder.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathMatchSpec
member.summary: Searches a string using a Microsoft MS-DOS wildcard match type.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to be searched.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the file type for which to search. For example, to test whether pszFile is a .doc file, pszSpec should be set to "*.doc".
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string matches, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathMatchSpecA
member.summary: Searches a string using a Microsoft MS-DOS wildcard match type.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to be searched.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the file type for which to search. For example, to test whether pszFile is a .doc file, pszSpec should be set to "*.doc".
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string matches, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathMatchSpecW
member.summary: Searches a string using a Microsoft MS-DOS wildcard match type.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to be searched.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the file type for which to search. For example, to test whether pszFile is a .doc file, pszSpec should be set to "*.doc".
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the string matches, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathMatchSpecEx
member.summary: Matches a file name from a path against one or more file name patterns.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path from which the file name to be matched is taken.

A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the file name pattern for which to search. This can be the exact name, or it can contain wildcard characters. If exactly one pattern is specified, set the PMSF_NORMAL flag in dwFlags. If more than one pattern is specified, separate them with semicolons and set the PMSF_MULTIPLE flag.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Modifies the search condition. The following are valid flags.
The pszSpec parameter points to a single file name pattern to be matched.
The pszSpec parameter points to a semicolon-delimited list of file name patterns to be matched.

If PMSF_NORMAL is used, don't ignore leading spaces in the string pointed to by pszSpec. If PMSF_MULTIPLE is used, don't ignore leading spaces in each file type contained in the string pointed to by pszSpec. This flag can be combined with PMSF_NORMAL and PMSF_MULTIPLE.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: A file name pattern specified in pszSpec matched the file name found in the string pointed to by pszFile.
No file name pattern specified in pszSpec matched the file name found in the string pointed to by pszFile.

The pszSpec parameter points to a single file name pattern to be matched.
The pszSpec parameter points to a semicolon-delimited list of file name patterns to be matched.

If PMSF_NORMAL is used, don't ignore leading spaces in the string pointed to by pszSpec. If PMSF_MULTIPLE is used, don't ignore leading spaces in each file type contained in the string pointed to by pszSpec. This flag can be combined with PMSF_NORMAL and PMSF_MULTIPLE.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: A file name pattern specified in pszSpec matched the file name found in the string pointed to by pszFile.
No file name pattern specified in pszSpec matched the file name found in the string pointed to by pszFile.

member.name: Windows.PathParseIconLocation
member.summary: Parses a file location string that contains a file location and icon index, and returns separate values.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains a file location string. It should be in the form "path,iconindex". When the function returns, pszIconFile will point to the file's path.
member.returns: Returns the valid icon index value.

member.summary: Parses a file location string that contains a file location and icon index, and returns separate values.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains a file location string. It should be in the form "path,iconindex". When the function returns, pszIconFile will point to the file's path.
member.returns: Returns the valid icon index value.

member.returns: Returns the valid icon index value.

member.name: Windows.PathQuoteSpaces
member.summary: Searches a path for spaces. If spaces are found, the entire path is enclosed in quotation marks.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to search. The size of this buffer must be set to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
member.returns: TRUE if spaces were found; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: Windows.PathQuoteSpacesA
member.summary: Searches a path for spaces. If spaces are found, the entire path is enclosed in quotation marks.

member.name: Windows.PathRelativePathTo
member.summary: Creates a relative path from one file or folder to another.
member.param: A pointer to a string that receives the relative path. This buffer must be at least MAX_PATH characters in size.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path that defines the start of the relative path.
The file attributes of pszFrom. If this value contains FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY, pszFrom is assumed to be a directory; otherwise, pszFrom is assumed to be a file.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path that defines the endpoint of the relative path.
The file attributes of pszTo. If this value contains FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY, pszTo is assumed to be directory; otherwise, pszTo is assumed to be a file.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathRelativePathToA
member.summary: Creates a relative path from one file or folder to another.
member.param: A pointer to a string that receives the relative path. This buffer must be at least MAX_PATH characters in size.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path that defines the start of the relative path.
The file attributes of pszFrom. If this value contains FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY, pszFrom is assumed to be a directory; otherwise, pszFrom is assumed to be a file.
A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path that defines the endpoint of the relative path.
The file attributes of pszTo. If this value contains FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY, pszTo is assumed to be directory; otherwise, pszTo is assumed to be a file.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful, or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.PathRemoveBackslash

summary.para: Removes the trailing backslash from a given path.
summary.div: Note This function is deprecated. We recommend the use of the or function in its place.

member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the path from which to remove the backslash.
member.returns: A pointer that, when this function returns successfully and if a backslash has been removed, points to the terminating null character that has replaced the backslash at the end of the string. If the path did not include a trailing backslash, this value will point to the final character in the string.

member.name: Windows.PathRenameExtension

summary.para: Replaces the extension of a file name with a new extension. If the file name does not contain an extension, the extension will be attached to the end of the string.
summary.div: Note Misuse of this function can lead to a buffer overrun. We recommend the use of the safer function in its place.

member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH in which to replace the extension.
Pointer to a character buffer that contains a '.' character followed by the new extension.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero if the new path and extension would exceed MAX_PATH characters.

member.name: Windows.PathSkipRoot
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the first character in a path following the drive letter or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) server/share path elements.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of maximum length MAX_PATH that contains the path to parse.
member.returns: A pointer that, when this function returns successfully, points to the beginning of the subpath that follows the root (drive letter or UNC server/share). If the function encounters an error, this value will be NULL.

member.name: Windows.PathStripToRoot

summary.para: Removes all file and directory elements in a path except for the root information.
summary.div: Note Misuse of this function can lead to a buffer overrun. We recommend the use of the safer function in its place.

member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string of length MAX_PATH that contains the path to be converted. When this function returns successfully, this string contains only the root information taken from that path.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if a valid drive letter was found in the path, or FALSE otherwise.

An array of structures. The last structure in the array must have its piid member set to NULL and its dwOffset member set to 0.
A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv.
When this method returns successfully, contains the interface pointer requested in riid.

member.name: Windows.SetProcessReference
member.summary: Provides a Component Object Model (COM) object that allows hosted Shell extensions and other components to prevent their host process from closing prematurely. The host process is typically Windows Explorer or Windows Internet Explorer, but this function can also be used by other applications.
member.param: A pointer to the object for which you want to store a reference. This value can be NULL.

member.name: Windows.SHAutoComplete
member.summary: Instructs system edit controls to use AutoComplete to help complete URLs or file system paths.
member.param: The window handle of a system edit control. Typically, this parameter is the handle of an edit control or the edit control embedded in a ComboBoxEx control.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: The flags to control the operation of SHAutoComplete. The first four flags are used to override the Internet Explorer registry settings. The user can change these settings manually by launching the Internet Options property sheet from the Tools menu and clicking the Advanced tab.
Ignore the registry default and force the AutoAppend feature off. This flag must be used in combination with one or more of the SHACF_FILESYS* or SHACF_URL* flags.

Ignore the registry value and force the AutoAppend feature on. The completed string will be displayed in the edit box with the added characters highlighted. This flag must be used in combination with one or more of the SHACF_FILESYS* or SHACF_URL* flags.
Ignore the registry default and force the AutoSuggest feature off. This flag must be used in combination with one or more of the SHACF_FILESYS* or SHACF_URL* flags.

Ignore the registry value and force the AutoSuggest feature on. A selection of possible completed strings will be displayed as a drop-down list, below the edit box. This flag must be used in combination with one or more of the SHACF_FILESYS* or SHACF_URL* flags.
The default setting, equivalent to SHACF_FILESYSTEM | SHACF_URLALL. SHACF_DEFAULT cannot be combined with any other flags.
Include the file system only.
Include the file system and directories, UNC servers, and UNC server shares.
Include the file system and the rest of the Shell (Desktop, Computer, and Control Panel, for example).
Include the URLs in the users History and Recently Used lists. Equivalent to SHACF_URLHISTORY | SHACF_URLMRU.
Include the URLs in the user's History list.
Include the URLs in the user's Recently Used list.

Allow the user to select from the autosuggest list by pressing the TAB key. If this flag is not set, pressing the TAB key will shift focus to the next control and close the autosuggest list. If SHACF_USETAB is set, pressing the TAB key will select the first item in the list. Pressing TAB again will select the next item in the list, and so on. When the user reaches the end of the list, the next TAB key press will cycle the focus back to the edit control. This flag must be used in combination with one or more of the SHACF_FILESYS* or SHACF_URL* flags listed on this page.

member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateMemStream
member.summary: Creates a memory stream using a similar process to .
member.param: A pointer to a buffer of size cbInit. The contents of this buffer are used to set the initial contents of the memory stream. If this parameter is NULL, the returned memory stream does not have any initial content.
The number of bytes in the buffer pointed to by pInit. If pInit is set to NULL, cbInit must be zero.
member.returns: On success, returns a pointer to the created memory stream. Returns NULL if the stream object could not be allocated.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateShellPalette
member.summary: Creates a halftone palette for the specified device context.
member.param: The device context.
member.returns: Returns the palette if successful; otherwise 0.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateStreamOnFileEx
member.summary: Opens or creates a file and retrieves a stream to read or write to that file.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the file name.
One or more STGM values that are used to specify the file access mode and how the object that exposes the stream is created and deleted.
One or more flag values that specify file attributes in the case that a new file is created. For a complete list of possible values, see the dwFlagsAndAttributes parameter of the function.
A BOOL value that helps specify, in conjunction with grfMode, how existing files should be treated when creating the stream. See Remarks for details.
Reserved.
Receives an interface pointer for the stream associated with the file.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateThread
member.summary: Creates a thread.
member.param: A pointer to an application-defined function of the LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE type. If a new thread was successfully created, this application-defined function is called in the context of that thread. SHCreateThread does not wait for the function pointed to by this parameter to complete before returning to its caller. The application-defined function's return value is the exit code of the thread.

A pointer to an optional application-defined data structure that contains initialization data. It is passed to the function pointed to by pfnThreadProc and, optionally, pfnCallback. This value can be NULL.
The flags that control the behavior of the function. One or more of the CTF constants.

A pointer to an optional application-defined function of theLPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE type. This function is called in the context of the created thread before the function pointed to bypfnThreadProc is called. It will also receive pData as its argument. SHCreateThread will wait for the function pointed to by pfnCallback to return before returning to its caller. The return value of the function pointed to by pfnCallback is ignored.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the thread is successfully created, or FALSE otherwise. On failure, use to retrieve the specific error value as shown here.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateThreadRef
member.summary: Creates a per-thread reference to a Component Object Model (COM) object.
member.param: A pointer to a value, usually a local variable in the thread's ThreadProc, that is used by the interface in ppunk as a reference counter.
The address of a pointer to an interface. If successful, this parameter holds the thread's IUnknown pointer on return. Your application is responsible for freeing the pointer when it is finished.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateThreadWithHandle
member.summary: Creates a new thread and retrieves its handle.
member.param: A pointer to an application-defined function of type LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE. If a new thread was successfully created, this application-defined function is called in the context of that thread. SHCreateThreadWithHandle does not wait for the function pointed to by pfnThreadProc to complete before returning to its caller. The return value for the function specified by pfnThreadProc is the exit code of the thread.

A pointer to an optional application-defined data structure that contains initialization data. It is passed to the function pointed to by pfnThreadProc and, optionally, the function pointed to by pfnCallback.
Flags that control the behavior of the function; one or more of the CTF constants.

A pointer to an optional application-defined function of type LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE. This function is called in the context of the created thread before the function pointed to by pfnThreadProc is called. It will also receive pData as its argument. SHCreateThreadWithHandle waits for the function pointed to by pfnCallback to complete before returning to its caller. The return value for the function specified by pfnCallback is ignored.
A pointer to the HANDLE of the created thread. When it is no longer needed, this handle should be closed by calling the function. This value can be NULL.
member.returns: TRUE if the thread is successfully created; otherwise, FALSE

member.name: Windows.SHEnumKeyEx
member.summary: Enumerates the subkeys of the specified open registry key.

param.name: hkey
param.para: A handle to the currently open key, or any of the following predefined values.

member.param: The index of the subkey to retrieve. This parameter should be zero for the first call and incremented for subsequent calls.
The address of a character buffer that receives the enumerated key name.
The address of a DWORD that, on entry, contains the size of the buffer at pszName, in characters. On exit, this contains the number of characters that were copied to pszName.

member.returns: The number of subkeys inserted into the array.

member.name: Windows.SHGetThreadRef
member.summary: Retrieves the per-thread object reference set by .
member.param: The address of a pointer that, when this function returns successfully, points to the object whose reference is stored. Your application is responsible for freeing this resource when it is no longer needed.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the object reference exists, or E_NOINTERFACE otherwise.

member.name: Windows.SHIsLowMemoryMachine
member.summary: Not supported.

param.name: dwType
param.para: The type of machine being examined. The following is the only recognized value.
An older (circa 1997), low-end machine. Since system resources in general were lower on these older machines, the low-memory threshold is accordingly lower.

returns.para: TRUE if the machine is considered low on resources, FALSE otherwise.
returns.div: Note Always returns FALSE under Windows XP.

member.name: Windows.SHLoadIndirectString
member.summary: Extracts a specified text resource when given that resource in the form of an indirect string (a string that begins with the '@' symbol).
member.param: A pointer to a buffer that contains the indirect string from which the resource will be retrieved. This string should begin with the '@' symbol and use one of the forms discussed in the Remarks section. This function will successfully accept a string that does not begin with an '@' symbol, but the string will be simply passed unchanged to pszOutBuf.

A pointer to a buffer that, when this function returns successfully, receives the text resource. Both pszOutBuf and pszSource can point to the same buffer, in which case the original string will be overwritten.
The size of the buffer pointed to by pszOutBuf, in characters.
Not used; set to NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHLocalStrDup
member.summary: Makes a copy of a string in newly allocated memory.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode string to be copied.

The address of a pointer to an allocated string that, when this function returns successfully, receives the result. SHLocalStrDup allocates memory for this string with . You should free the string with when it is no longer needed.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHOpenRegStream2
member.summary: Opens a registry value and supplies a stream that can be used to read from or write to the value. This function supersedes .
member.param: Required. The subtree, such as HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, that contains the value.
Optional. Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the subkey that contains the value. This value can be NULL.
Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the value to be accessed. This value can be NULL.

param.name: grfMode
param.para: The type of access for the stream. This can be one of the following values:
Open the stream for reading.
Open the stream for writing.
Open the stream for reading and writing.

member.returns: Returns an interface pointer if successful; otherwise, NULL. A NULL value can be caused by several situations, including an invalid hkey or pszSubkey, a subkey named by pszSubkey that does not exist, a caller without sufficient permissions to access the subkey, or an inability to open the stream.

member.name: Windows.SHOpenRegStream

summary.para: Deprecated. Opens a registry value and supplies a stream that can be used to read from or write to the value.
summary.div: Note This function has been replaced by . It is recommended that you use SHOpenRegStream2 at all times.

member.param: Required. The subtree, such as HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, that contains the value.
Optional. Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the subkey that contains the value. This value can be NULL.
Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the value to be accessed. This value can be NULL.

param.name: grfMode
param.para: The type of access for the stream. This can be one of the following values:
Open the stream for reading.
Open the stream for writing.
Open the stream for both reading and writing.

returns.para: Returns an interface pointer if successful; otherwise, NULL. A NULL value can be caused by several situations, including an invalid hkey or pszSubkey, or an inability to open the stream.
returns.div: Note In some situations, such as when the subkey named by pszSubkey does not exist or the caller does not have sufficient permissions to access the subkey, a zero-length stream is returned rather than a NULL value. returns NULL in all error situations and is the preferred function for that reason.

Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the value to be accessed. This value can be NULL.

param.name: grfMode
param.para: The type of access for the stream. This can be one of the following values:
Open the stream for reading.
Open the stream for writing.
Open the stream for both reading and writing.

returns.para: Returns an interface pointer if successful; otherwise, NULL. A NULL value can be caused by several situations, including an invalid hkey or pszSubkey, or an inability to open the stream.
returns.div: Note In some situations, such as when the subkey named by pszSubkey does not exist or the caller does not have sufficient permissions to access the subkey, a zero-length stream is returned rather than a NULL value. returns NULL in all error situations and is the preferred function for that reason.

member.name: Windows.SHQueryInfoKey
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specified registry key.

param.name: hkey
param.para: A handle to the currently open key, or any of the following predefined values.

member.param: The address of a DWORD that receives the number of subkeys under the specified key.
The address of a DWORD that receives the number of characters in the name of the subkey with the largest name.
The address of a DWORD that receives the number of values under the specified key.
The address of a DWORD that receives the number of characters in the name of the value with the largest name.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a textual description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHQueryValueEx
member.summary: Opens a registry key and queries it for a specific value.

param.name: hkey
param.para: A handle to the currently open key, or any of the following predefined values.

member.param: The address of the null-terminated string that contains the name of the value to be queried.
Reserved. Must be NULL.
The address of the variable that receives the key's value type. For more information, see Registry Data Types.
The address of the buffer that receives the value's data. This parameter can be NULL if the data is not required.

The address of the variable that specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pvData parameter. When the function returns, this variable contains the size of the data copied to pvData.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegCloseUSKey
member.summary: Closes a handle to a user-specific registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSKey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. Use with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegCreateUSKey
member.summary: Creates or opens a registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the subkey to be created or opened. If a value with this name is already present in the subkey, it will be opened.
The desired security access. For more information on security access, see REGSAM.

The key to be used as a base for relative paths. If pszPath is a relative path, the key it specifies will be relative to hRelativeUSKey. If pszPath is an absolute path, set hRelativeUSKey to NULL. The key will then be created under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE or HKEY_CURRENT_USER, depending the value of dwFlags.
A pointer to an HUSKEY that will receive the handle to the new key.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: The base key under which the key should be opened. This can be one or more of the following values.
Create/open the key under HKEY_CURRENT_USER. Only creates a key if it is empty.
Create/open the key under HKEY_CURRENT_USER. Creates a key even if it is not empty.
Create/open the key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Only creates a key if it is empty.
Create/open the key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. Creates a key even if it is not empty.
Create/open the key under both HKEY_CURRENT_USER (forced) and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (only if empty). This flag is the equivalent of (SHREGSET_FORCE_HKCU | SHREGSET_HKLM).

member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegDeleteEmptyUSKey
member.summary: Deletes an empty registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSKey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

member.param: A pointer to the null-terminated string that specifies the empty user-defined registry subkey to be deleted.
One of the that specifies from which base key the subkey will be deleted.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegEnumUSKey

A pointer to a DWORD that, on entry, contains the size of the buffer at pszName, in characters. On exit, this contains the number of characters that were copied to pszName.

member.name: Windows.SHRegEnumUSValue
member.summary: Enumerates the values of the specified registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSkey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

member.param: The index of the value to retrieve. This parameter should be zero for the first call and incremented for subsequent calls.
A pointer to a character buffer that receives the enumerated value name. The size of this buffer is specified in pcchValueNameLen.
A pointer to a DWORD that, on entry, contains the size of the buffer at pszValueName, in characters. On exit, this contains the number of characters that were copied to pszValueName.
A pointer to a DWORD that receives the data type of the value. These are the same values as those described under the lpType parameter of .
A pointer to a buffer that receives the data for the value entry. The size of this buffer is specified in pcbData. This parameter can be NULL if the data is not required.
A pointer to a DWORD that, on entry, contains the size of the buffer at pvData. On exit, this contains the number of bytes that were copied to pvData.
One of the that specifies the base key in which the enumeration should take place.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a textual description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegGetBoolUSValue
member.summary: Retrieves a Boolean value from a registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the subkey relative to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and HKEY_CURRENT_USER. For example, "Software\MyCompany\MyProduct".
A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the value. This value can be NULL.
A variable that specifies which key to look under. When set to TRUE, ignores HKEY_CURRENT_USER and returns a value from HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
A value that is returned if there is no registry value.
member.returns: Returns either the value from the registry, or fDefault if none is found.

member.name: Windows.SHRegGetIntW
member.summary: Reads a numeric string value from the registry and converts it to an integer.
member.param: A handle to the registry key that specifies the value to be read.
A pointer to a string value that specifies the name of the value to be read. The string must be null-terminated.
An int that specifies the value returned if the registry value cannot be retrieved successfully.
member.returns: Returns the converted string as an int, or the default value specified by nDefault.

member.name: Windows.SHRegGetPath
member.summary: Retrieves a file path from the registry, expanding environment variables as needed.
member.param: A handle to a key that is currently open, or a registry root key.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the subkey.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the value that holds the unexpanded path string.
A buffer to hold the expanded path. You should set the size of this buffer to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
Reserved.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a Windows error code otherwise.

member.summary: Retrieves a file path from the registry, expanding environment variables as needed.
member.param: A handle to a key that is currently open, or a registry root key.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the subkey.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the value that holds the unexpanded path string.
A buffer to hold the expanded path. You should set the size of this buffer to MAX_PATH to ensure that it is large enough to hold the returned string.
Reserved.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a Windows error code otherwise.

member.name: Windows.SHRegGetUSValue
member.summary: Retrieves a value from a registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the subkey relative to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and HKEY_CURRENT_USER. For example: "Software\MyCompany\MyProduct".
A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the value. This value can be NULL.

A pointer to a DWORD that receives the type of data stored in the retrieved value. When using default values, the input pdwType is the type of the default value. For possible values, see Registry Data Types. If type information is not required, this parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the value's data.
A pointer to a variable that specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by pvData. When SHRegGetUSValue returns, pcbData contains the size of the data copied to pvData.
A variable that specifies which key to look under. When set to TRUE, SHRegGetUSValue ignores HKEY_CURRENT_USER and returns the value from the key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the value's default data.
The length, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by pvDefaultData.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegOpenUSKey
member.summary: Opens a registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the subkey.
The desired security access. For more information on security access, see REGSAM.
The key to be used as a base for relative paths. If pszPath is a relative path, the key it specifies will be relative to hRelativeUSKey. If pszPath is an absolute path, set hRelativeUSKey to NULL.
A pointer to the handle of the opened key.
The variable that specifies which key to look under. When set to TRUE, SHRegOpenUSKey ignores HKEY_CURRENT_USER and returns a value from HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

A pointer to the handle of the opened key.

member.name: Windows.SHRegQueryInfoUSKey
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specified registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSKey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

member.param: A pointer to a DWORD that receives the number of subkeys under the specified key.
A pointer to a DWORD that receives the number of characters in the largest subkey name.
A pointer to a DWORD that receives the number of values under the specified key.
A pointer to a DWORD that receives the number of characters in the largest value name.
One of the that specifies the base key in which the query should take place.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a textual description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegQueryUSValue
member.summary: Retrieves the type and data for a specified name associated with an open registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSKey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey, or one of the following predefined values. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

member.param: A pointer to the null-terminated string that contains the name of the value to be queried.
A pointer to the variable that sets or receives the key's value type. For more information, see Registry Data Types. This parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to the buffer that receives the value's data. This parameter can be NULL if the data is not required.
A pointer to the variable that specifies the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pvData parameter. When the function returns, this variable contains the size of the data copied to pvData.
The variable that specifies which key to look under. When set to TRUE, SHRegQueryUSValue ignores HKEY_CURRENT_USER and returns the value from the key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
A pointer to the default data.
The length, in bytes, of the default data.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

The variable that specifies which key to look under. When set to TRUE, SHRegQueryUSValue ignores HKEY_CURRENT_USER and returns the value from the key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
A pointer to the default data.

param.name: dwDefaultDataSize
param.para: The length, in bytes, of the default data.

member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegSetPath
member.summary: Takes a file path, replaces folder names with environment strings, and places the resulting string in the registry.
member.param: A handle to a key that is currently open, or a registry root key.
A pointer to a null-terminated string containing the name of an existing subkey. If the subkey does not exist, SHRegSetPath will fail.
A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the value to hold the path string.
A pointer to a null-terminated string with a fully qualified file path.
Reserved.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a Windows error code otherwise.

member.name: Windows.SHRegSetUSValue
member.summary: Sets a registry subkey value in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string with the name of the subkey.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the value.
Type of data to be stored. This parameter must be the REG_SZ type. For more information, see Registry Data Types.
Apointer to a null-terminated string that contains the value to be set for the specified key.
Length, in bytes, of the string pointed to by the pvData parameter, not including the terminating null character.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Flags indicating where the data should be written.
Write to HKEY_CURRENT_USER if empty.
Write to HKEY_CURRENT_USER.
Write to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE if empty.
Write to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.
Equivalent to (SHREGSET_FORCE_HKCU | SHREGSET_HKLM).

member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegSetValue

summary.para: Not supported.
Sets a registry value.
Use in its place.

param.name: hkey
param.para: A handle to the currently open key, or any of the following predefined values.

member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the relative path from hkey to the subkey from which to retrieve the value. This parameter can be NULL or an empty string, in which case the data is retrieved from the hkey location.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the value. This parameter can be NULL or an empty string, in which case the data is retrieved from the Default value.
One or more of the SRRF flags that restricts the data to be set. At least one type restriction (SRRF_RT) value must be specified.

The DWORD that indicates the type of data stored in the value to be set. When using default values, the input dwType is the type of the default value. For possible values, see Registry Data Types. If the SRRF_NOEXPAND flag is not set, REG_EXPAND_SZ types are automatically expanded and returned as REG_SZ. If type information is not required, this parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to a buffer that contains the value's data. This parameter can be NULL if the data is not needed.
The size of the source data buffer pvData, in bytes. This value can be NULL only if pvData is NULL.
member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful, or a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h otherwise. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.

member.name: Windows.SHRegWriteUSValue
member.summary: Writes a value to a registry subkey in a user-specific subtree (HKEY_CURRENT_USER or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE).

param.name: hUSKey
param.para: A handle to a currently open registry subkey. The subkey must have been opened with the KEY_SET_VALUE access right. For more information, see Registry Key Security and Access Rights.
This handle can be obtained through the function.

param.name: pszValue
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the value. This value is an entry in the subkey specified by hUSKey. If a value with this name is not already present in the subkey, it will be added.
If this parameter is NULL or an empty string, the function sets the type and data for the subkey's Default value.

param.name: dwType
param.para: The type of the data to be stored in the value specified by pszValue. One of the following registry value types defined in Winnt.h and Wdm.h.

member.param: A pointer to the data to be set for the value specified by pszValue. For string-based types, such as REG_SZ, the string must be null-terminated. With the REG_MULTI_SZ data type, the string must be terminated with two null characters. A backslash in a path must be preceded by another backslash as an escape character. For example, specify "C:\mydir\myfile" to store the string "C:\mydir\myfile".

The size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the pvData parameter. If the data is of type REG_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, or REG_MULTI_SZ, cbData must include the size of the terminating null character or characters.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Flags that indicate the subtree to which the data should be written. One or more of the following values:
Write to HKEY_CURRENT_USER only if a value of the name specified in pszValue does not currently exist under the specified subkey.
Write to HKEY_CURRENT_USER. If a value of the name specified in pszValue already exists, it will be overwritten.
Write to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE only if a value of the name specified in pszValue does not currently exist under the specified subkey..
Write to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE. If a value of the name specified in pszValue already exists, it will be overwritten.
Equivalent to (SHREGSET_FORCE_HKCU | SHREGSET_HKLM).

member.returns: Returns ERROR_SUCCESS if successful; otherwise, a nonzero error code defined in Winerror.h. You can use the function with the FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM flag to retrieve a generic description of the error.
